title.narrative: Link Home Based Workrs to Pvt. Sectr Mkt

description.narrative: Linking Home Based Workers to Private Sector Market Project Information: The proposed project activities are designed in regards toneed-based training and awareness for livelihood of targeted women which are prerequisite for community development if women are well equipped and trained then development and making community realize their role becomes easy and accessible. The proposed project is designed in the three thematic areas to address the problems that home based workers encounter; 1. Community Development, 2. Capacity Building, 3. Advocacy, Networking and Linkages Development. The project area consist of 17 villages of Union councils Hadal Shah(10 villages) and Kot Mir Mohammad (7 villages). Total households in the target villages are 1077 witha total population of 7558. According to a rough estimate around 300 households directly depend on different types of home made products and handicrafts like Rillis (local handmade bed sheets), caps, Dabkis (case of meals), mats and embroidery Key proposed activities: Baseline survey 100 mobilization meetings with HBWs 5 orientation workshops/seminars Formation of 17 CIG#s development of 17 disaster management plans end line survey Identification of 300 women for training TNA (Training Need Assessment)of the women Preparation of training manual Organize 17 trainings for 300 home-based workers and members of trade unions are trained on organization management and collective bargaining and marketing (Per training 18 participants) 60 awareness sessions will be conducted to create awareness among other stakeholderregarding the issues of HBWs, role of ILO and UNIFEM, ILO convention 102 and labour policy for HBWs in other South Asian countries Conduct a Center Assessment for Identification of business stakeholders for linkages development Development of Marketing Strategy,2 Exhibitions and 5 exposure visits. Identification/selection of 34 women to work as marketing persons 3 Advocacy workshops will beconducted with HBWs and groups of other stakeholders to share the progress and develop agreed action plan.

participating-org.narrative: Fast Rural Development Program (FRDP) is a nonprofit and nongovernmental organization, registered under the societies act xxi of 1860, working in the rural areas of Sindh, Pakistan. The program is aimed at facilitating the rural communities in a way that they can be empowered to secure their rights with command over the resources and capabilities to manage the process of sustainable development. FRDP is involved with overall integrated rural development but her major focus is to promote health <(>&<)> hygiene, relief support activities, improve education status to support the target of universal primary education (UPE) goal, poverty alleviation, rights protection, water and sanitation and capacity building, in five districts of Sindh province.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
